verses.kjv: After these things the word of the LORD came unto Abram in a vision, saying, Fear not, Abram: I am thy shield, and thy exceeding great reward.
verses.ct: Some time later, the word of the LORD came to Abram through a vision: "Do not be afraid, Abram. I am your shield and your very great reward."

verses.kjv: And Abram said, LORD God, what wilt thou give me, seeing I go childless, and the steward of my house is this Eliezer of Damascus?
verses.ct: Abram replied, "Lord GOD, what can you possibly give me, since I remain without children? The one who will inherit my household is Eliezer of Damascus."

verses.kjv: And Abram said, Behold, to me thou hast given no seed: and, lo, one born in my house is mine heir.
verses.ct: Abram continued, "Look, you have not given me any offspring, so a servant born in my household will be my heir."

verses.kjv: And, behold, the word of the LORD came unto him, saying, This shall not be thine heir; but he that shall come forth out of thine own bowels shall be thine heir.
verses.ct: Then the word of the LORD came to him: "That man will not be your heir. Instead, a son from your own body will be your heir."

verses.kjv: And he brought him forth abroad, and said, Look now toward heaven, and tell the stars, if thou be able to number them: and he said unto him, So shall thy seed be.
verses.ct: The LORD took him outside and said, "Gaze up at the heavens and try to count the stars, if you can." Then he told him, "That is how numerous your offspring will be."

verses.kjv: And he believed in the LORD; and he counted it to him for righteousness.
verses.ct: Abram believed in the LORD, and he counted it to him for righteousness.

verses.kjv: And he said unto him, I am the LORD that brought thee out of Ur of the Chaldees, to give thee this land to inherit it.
verses.ct: The LORD also told him, "I am the LORD who brought you out of Ur of the Chaldees to give you this land as your possession."

verses.kjv: And he said, LORD God, whereby shall I know that I shall inherit it?
verses.ct: Abram asked, "Lord GOD, how can I be certain that I will possess it?"

verses.kjv: And he said unto him, Take me an heifer of three years old, and a she goat of three years old, and a ram of three years old, and a turtledove, and a young pigeon.
verses.ct: The LORD answered him, "Bring me a three-year-old heifer, a three-year-old female goat, a three-year-old ram, a turtledove, and a young pigeon."

verses.kjv: And he took unto him all these, and divided them in the midst, and laid each piece one against another: but the birds divided he not.
verses.ct: Abram brought all of these, cut them down the middle, and arranged the halves opposite each other. However, he did not cut the birds in two.

verses.kjv: And when the fowls came down upon the carcases, Abram drove them away.
verses.ct: Birds of prey swooped down on the carcasses, but Abram chased them off.

verses.kjv: And when the sun was going down, a deep sleep fell upon Abram; and, lo, an horror of great darkness fell upon him.
verses.ct: As the sun was setting, a deep sleep overcame Abram, and a dreadful, thick darkness pressed down on him.

verses.kjv: And he said unto Abram, Know of a surety that thy seed shall be a stranger in a land that is not theirs, and shall serve them; and they shall afflict them four hundred years;
verses.ct: Then the LORD told Abram, "Know for certain that your descendants will be foreigners in a country that does not belong to them. They will be enslaved and oppressed for four hundred years.

verses.kjv: And also that nation, whom they shall serve, will I judge: and afterward shall they come out with great substance.
verses.ct: "But I will judge the nation they serve, and afterward they will leave with great wealth.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt go to thy fathers in peace; thou shalt be buried in a good old age.
verses.ct: "As for you, you will join your ancestors in peace and be buried at a ripe old age.

verses.kjv: But in the fourth generation they shall come hither again: for the iniquity of the Amorites is not yet full.
verses.ct: "In the fourth generation, your descendants will return here, because the sin of the Amorites has not yet reached its full measure."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that, when the sun went down, and it was dark, behold a smoking furnace, and a burning lamp that passed between those pieces.
verses.ct: After the sun had set and darkness had fallen, a smoking firepot and a flaming torch passed between the divided pieces.

verses.kjv: In the same day the LORD made a covenant with Abram, saying, Unto thy seed have I given this land, from the river of Egypt unto the great river, the river Euphrates:
verses.ct: On that day the LORD made a covenant with Abram, declaring, "To your offspring I have given this land, from the river of Egypt all the way to the great river, the Euphratesâ€”

verses.kjv: The Kenites, and the Kenizzites, and the Kadmonites,
verses.ct: the land of the Kenites, the Kenizzites, the Kadmonites,

verses.kjv: And the Hittites, and the Perizzites, and the Rephaims,
verses.ct: the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Rephaims,

verses.kjv: And the Amorites, and the Canaanites, and the Girgashites, and the Jebusites.
verses.ct: the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Girgashites, and the Jebusites."
